Description: Tondo sherd of Attic red-figured pottery cup with top of stem; interior: red-figure decoration consisting of part of a bearded man in himation reclining to left and looking round, with kylix in his hand; brown inner markings; relief-contour; exterior, glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix '8' was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish it from the other 1912.39 sherds. Compared to Douris by Beazley.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 516, no. C93)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0705) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain Fasc. 3, Oxford Fasc. 1 (p. 12, pl. XIV, no. 8)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
